# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Count & Layers:
- Total blocks used: 6 blocks
- Number of layers: 3 layers

## Spatial Relationships:
- Bottom layer: A red arch block with an orange cylindrical tower to its right
- Middle layer: A horizontal green rectangular block placed on top of the red arch
- Top layer (left): A blue cube sits on top of the green block with an orange triangular roof
- Top layer (right): The orange cylindrical tower extends from bottom to middle layer and has an orange triangular roof

# Required Blocks from Dictionary

The blocks needed to construct this structure are:
- Block #1: Red arch block (foundation, left side)
- Block #12: Orange cylindrical tower (right side)
- Block #11: Green rectangular block (middle horizontal piece)
- Block #6: Blue cube (upper left)
- Block #15: Orange triangular roof (for blue cube)
- Block #14: Orange triangular roof (for cylindrical tower)

# Assembly Order

```
{
  Step1: Move block with index 1
  Step2: Move block with index 12
  Step3: Move block with index 11
  Step4: Move block with index 6
  Step5: Move block with index 15
  Step6: Move block with index 14
}
```

This assembly sequence follows a bottom-to-top approach, starting with the foundation pieces, then adding the middle layer, and finally placing the top elements to complete the structure.
